com.phunware.mapping

Interface PwMapViewLayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PwBlueDotLayer, PwMarkerLayer, PwRouteLayer

    public interface PwMapViewLayer
    This is a layer that should be drawn on the map view. The layer can draw whatever it needs to on the canvas through onDraw(android.content.Context, android.graphics.Canvas, com.phunware.mapping.model.PwCoordinateSpace, int, android.content.res.Resources).

    Activity lifecycle events will be forwarded to layers as well.

    • onCreate(savedInstanceState)
    • onSaveInstanceState(outState)
    • onDestroy()
    • onLowMemory()

    • Method Detail

      • onDraw

        void onDraw(android.content.Context context,
          android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
          PwCoordinateSpace coordinateSpace,
          int zoomLevel,
          android.content.res.Resources res)
        Use the canvas given here to draw on top of the canvas. This will draw on top of the map. The map will provide all interaction implementations such as rotation, translation, or scaling.

        The coordinateSpace should be used to convert map coordinates to the canvas' coordinates.

        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        canvas - Canvas to draw on.
        coordinateSpace - The coordinate space of the map.
        zoomLevel - The current zoom level (1..5).
        res - Resources to help draw with.

      • onTouchUp

        boolean onTouchUp(android.graphics.PointF mapPoint,
                android.graphics.PointF touchPoint)
        Called when the user lifts a pointer from the screen. For example, when a user presses on the screen that is considered a touch down event and when the user lifts that finger it is considered a touch up. This is called when the last pointer has lifted from the screen.
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - The point on the map that was touched.
        touchPoint - The point on the view that was touched. This should always be on the screen.
        Returns:
        True if the event is handled here and should not propagate to other layers. False if the event is not handled or the event should still propagate to other layers.

      • onTouchDown

        boolean onTouchDown(android.graphics.PointF mapPoint,
                  android.graphics.PointF touchPoint)
        Called when the user touches a pointer on the screen. If multiple pointers enter the screen then this is called only for the first pointer. Once all pointers are removed then this may be called again for the next pointer that enters.
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - The point on the map that was touched.
        touchPoint - The point on the view that was touched. This should always be on the screen.
        Returns:
        True if the event is handled here and should not propagate to other layers. False if the event is not handled or the event should still propagate to other layers.

      • onCreate

        void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState,
            PwMapView pwMapView)
        Called from the activities onCreate method. This is called after the MapView is initialized and is loading, or when this layer is first added to the map view.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Saved state bundle. Contains anything saved in onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle).
        pwMapView - The map view that this layer is attached to.

      • onDestroy

        void onDestroy()
        Called from the activities onDestroy method. This should be used to clean up any resources.

      • onLowMemory

        void onLowMemory()
        Called when then device is low on memory. This is recommended to use to free up anything that may not be needed.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outstate)
        Called from the activities onSaveInstanceState. Use the outstate to save anything that should be obtained in onCreate(android.os.Bundle, PwMapView)
        Parameters:
        outstate - Bundle to save parameters in.
